wikipedia_page.main: Ernest W. Jones (c. 1891 – death unknown) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1910s and 1920s. He played at representative level for Great Britain and England, and at club level for Rochdale Hornets, as a stand-off or scrum-half, i.e. number 6 or 7.

response: Ernest Jones (1879–1958) was a Welsh neurologist, psychoanalyst, and Sigmund Freud's official biographer.
Ernest Jones may also refer to:
*Ernest Jones (rugby league), rugby league footballer of the 1910s and 1920s for Great Britain, England, and Rochdale Hornets
*Ernest Jones (retailer), a national jewellery retailer in the United Kingdom, owned by Signet Group

link_mentions.page: Template talk:Great Britain squad – 1920 Australia & New Zealand Tourists
response: The photograph entitled Great Britain Rugby League Touring Team - Australasia 1924 does not show Ernest Jones (rugby league), and Bobby Lloyd but they did play in Test matches on this tour. Alf Wood (rugby) (), William Reid (rugby league) (position?), George Rees (rugby) (), are shown on the photograph, they didn't play in Test matches on this tour, but they may have played in tour matches, or had to withdraw from the tour after the photograph was taken. Joseph Doyle (rugby league) (), shown on the photograph, didn't play in Test matches on this tour, but he did play in tour matches on this tour.
* Ernest Jones, half back for Rochdale Hornets
